qas.question: What do mechanically controlled variable capacitors enable to be modified?
How do cheap variable capacitors vary the separation distance between layers of a plastic and aluminum?
Of what type of diodes are varactors or varicaps comprised?
What varies as a function of voltage in varactors?
What is an application of varactors?
What do mechanically controlled variable capacitors disable to be modified?
How do cheap variable capacitors vary the separation distance against layers of a plastic and aluminum?
Of what type of diodes are varactors or varicaps uncomprised?
What doesn't vary as a function of voltage in varactors?
What is not an application of varactors?

context: Mechanically controlled variable capacitors allow <a0_0>the <b5_0>plate spacing<b5_0/><a0_0/> to be adjusted, for example by rotating or sliding a set of movable plates into alignment with a set of stationary plates. Low cost variable capacitors squeeze together alternating layers of aluminum and plastic <a1_0><b6_0>with a screw<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Electrical control of capacitance is achievable with varactors (or varicaps), which are <a2_0><b7_0>reverse-biased semiconductor<b7_0/> diodes<a2_0/> whose <a3_0><b8_0>depletion region<b8_0/><a3_0/> width varies with applied voltage. They are used in <a4_0><b9_0>phase-locked loops<b9_0/><a4_0/>, amongst other applications.
